noteGrp.note: Ibn ʿArabī’s great summary of esoteric knowledge, consisting of 560 chapters and extending to nearly 10,000 pages in the holograph. It totalises all aspects of his work and all the esoteric knowledge of his era. The first recension, completed in Ṣafar 629H, exists only in copies, while the second, written between 632H and 636H, survives in IA’s own hand (see Evkaf Muzesi 1845+). There is still work to be done in distinguishing between the two recensions in the mss base, but considerable progress has been made by Julian Cook and Claude Addas in identifying “markers” which indicate the recension of any given ms. Their research indicates that many later mss. may be hybrids of the two recensions. For details of their work on the two recensions, see ancillary documents.
Verified by many mss. in both recensions. The best of the second recension is Evkaf Muzesi 1845+ in 37 volumes, which is the original in IA’s hand, written in 636H and carrying over 71 samāʿ.
